content:
• Thursday, July 14, 2011
  • GOOG

    Google's (NASDAQ:GOOG) earnings call includes some encouraging mobile division data: daily...

    Google's (NASDAQ:GOOG) earnings call includes some encouraging mobile division data: daily Android activations are now above 550K; traffic for its AdMob mobile ad network has grown 3.5x in the last year; and 6B Android apps have been downloaded - this holds up well against Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) 15B App Store downloads, given Apple's head start. Shares +12.1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM
  • FLIR

    Thermal imaging system firm FLIR Systems (NASDAQ:FLIR) is down 8% AH after guiding for FQ2...

    Thermal imaging system firm FLIR Systems (NASDAQ:FLIR) is down 8% AH after guiding for FQ2 revenues of approximately $390M and EPS of $0.18 - well below consensus estimates of $411M and $0.39. The company attributes the shortfall to weak demand in its Government Systems division. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:24 PM
  • GOOG

    Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) confirms in an upbeat earnings call that Google+ has 10M members since its...

    Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) confirms in an upbeat earnings call that Google+ has 10M members since its invite-only launch, and that the "+1" button for recommending sites has been served 2.3B times a day. The company is trying to simplify even as its revenues spread beyond core search to YouTube and mobiles. GOOG +11.5% AH. (earnings beat)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:13 PM
  • TWO

    Two Harbors (NYSE:TWO) files a 35M share secondary offering. The company plans to use the...

    Two Harbors (NYSE:TWO) files a 35M share secondary offering. The company plans to use the proceeds to purchase residential mortgage-backed securities, and to finance acquisitions of residential mortgage loans. Shares -3.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • GOOG

    Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) is now up 11.4% AH following its earnings beat, and other Internet stocks...

    Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) is now up 11.4% AH following its earnings beat, and other Internet stocks are moving higher in sympathy. YHOO +1.7%. AMZN +1.3%. BIDU +2.4%. EBAY +2.4%. LNKD +1.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • NWS

    Following earlier quotes where Rupert Murdoch defended News Corp. (NWS -2.3%) hacking-scandal...

    Following earlier quotes where Rupert Murdoch defended News Corp. (NWS -2.3%) hacking-scandal conduct ("minor mistakes"), WSJ posts detail from its interview. Damage will be recovered as the company has "a reputation of great good works in this country." His reaction to the negative headlines: "Just getting annoyed. I'll get over it. I'm tired."
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM | 2 Comments
  • GOOG

    Google (NASDAQ:GOOG): Jumps 10.1% AH on a killer earnings beat. Revenue, ex-traffic acquisition,...

    Google (NASDAQ:GOOG): Jumps 10.1% AH on a killer earnings beat. Revenue, ex-traffic acquisition, of $6.92B beat consensus of $6.55B. Sites revenues of $6.23B; networks revenues of $2.48B. Paid clicks up 18% and cost per click up 12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • NWS

    Murdoch speaks: News Corp. (NWS -2.4%) has made "minor mistakes," its chief tells WSJ, and the...

    Murdoch speaks: News Corp. (NWS -2.4%) has made "minor mistakes," its chief tells WSJ, and the damage to the company is "nothing that will not be recovered." They've handled the hacking fiasco "extremely well in every way possible." Full interview soon. (earlier: FBI probe)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 2 Comments
  • AVAV

    AeroVironment (AVAV -7.2%) is downgraded by Raymond James, citing a recent expansion of the...

    AeroVironment (AVAV -7.2%) is downgraded by Raymond James, citing a recent expansion of the maker of unmanned aircraft system's valuation and concerns that first-half 2012 estimates are bloated. The firm says that while it's excited about the company's electric vehicle charging unit, the impact on 2012 earnings likely will be minimal.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM
  • COP

    As ConocoPhillips (COP +1.8%) gives back most of its early-morning gains, Deutsche Bank's Paul...

    As ConocoPhillips (COP +1.8%) gives back most of its early-morning gains, Deutsche Bank's Paul Sankey talks of the Street having mixed feelings about the company's plans to split itself. While positive on ConocoPhillips' refining business, Sankey questions the logic of having the struggling exploration and production business trade alone.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • MBI

    Details on the jump in MBIA (MBI +8.9%): BofA (BAC -0.6%) has made a preliminary offer to settle...

    Details on the jump in MBIA (MBI +8.9%): BofA (BAC -0.6%) has made a preliminary offer to settle a suit on defective mortgages, although a payment amount is still in dispute - and there are still more suits between the pair.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM
  • MBI

    Bond insurer MBIA (NYSE:MBI) trips the breakers up 8.4% on rumors of a mortgage-suit settlement...

    Bond insurer MBIA (NYSE:MBI) trips the breakers up 8.4% on rumors of a mortgage-suit settlement with Bank of America (NYSE:BAC). (CNBC)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM
  • CBI

    Chicago Bridge & Iron (CBI +5%) holds on to gains after announcing it won a $2.3B contract...

    Chicago Bridge & Iron (CBI +5%) holds on to gains after announcing it won a $2.3B contract with Chevron Australia to provide mechanical, electrical and instrumentation work for the company's Gorgon gas fields project.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM | 1 Comment
  • SPWR

    Shares of SunPower (SPWRA +5.7%) soar to a new 52-week high as solar industry blogs light up...

    Shares of SunPower (SPWRA +5.7%) soar to a new 52-week high as solar industry blogs light up with rumors of increasing commercial uses for its solar products.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • MAR

    Marriott International's (MAR -2.6%) disappointing forecast for FY11 EPS is dragging down the...

    Marriott International's (MAR -2.6%) disappointing forecast for FY11 EPS is dragging down the sector. Sympathy slides: Starwood (HOT -2.1%), Hyatt Hotels (H -2.0%), Host Hotels & Resorts (HST -3.1%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX -3%) says it realized "some people would be concerned" about its new pricing plan,...

    Netflix (NFLX -3%) says it realized "some people would be concerned" about its new pricing plan, but a "silent majority" of subscribers will realize the $15.98 price for combination DVD-and-streaming video plan still represents a good value. Investors may be starting to notice the customer anger, as shares have given back all of their gains since the price hike announcement.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM | 6 Comments
  • P

    Pandora (NYSE:P) is down 4.6% in the wake of Spotify's U.S. launch. But while Spotify will...

    Pandora (NYSE:P) is down 4.6% in the wake of Spotify's U.S. launch. But while Spotify will immediately be a major rival to Pandora for PC streaming, it may be less of one on mobile devices, given that the free version of Spotify's streaming service isn't available on them. Mobile devices now account for over half of all of Pandora's streaming.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:20 PM | 9 Comments
  • BAC

    Bank of America (BAC -0.7%) hits a new 52 week low of $10.13 and seems poised to test the single...

    Bank of America (BAC -0.7%) hits a new 52 week low of $10.13 and seems poised to test the single digit level for the first time since May 2009. Two QEs, essentially free overnight borrowings, a record-steep yield curve, and this is the result? Zombie bank indeed.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM | 5 Comments
  • KCI

    Shares of Kinetic Concepts (KCI +0.4%) level on 4X normal trading after the firm receives a...

    Shares of Kinetic Concepts (KCI +0.4%) level on 4X normal trading after the firm receives a downgrade from Stephens to Equal Weight from Overweight. In addition, new details emerge about a $6.3B offer to buy the firm, including the fact it has a "go-period" until August 21 to shop for a better price, according to a SEC filing.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • HOGS

    Zhongpin (HOGS -10.5%) tanks after China announces it will resume a $385M investment program...

    Zhongpin (HOGS -10.5%) tanks after China announces it will resume a $385M investment program aimed at supporting large-scale pig farms. The goal of the program is to increase domestic pork supply and bring down surging prices. China's pork prices have risen steadily since March 2010, reaching record highs mid-June of this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • MCPIQ

    Following a WTO censure, China is restoring export curbs on rare earth metals to near-2010...

    Following a WTO censure, China is restoring export curbs on rare earth metals to near-2010 levels. However, the EU isn't satisfied, with one official saying a first analysis shows "no noticeable change" in exports to the EU. Rare earth miners are moving lower today. MCP -2.3%. AVL -2.4%. REE -1.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • TAT

    TransAtlantic Petroleum (TAT -6.9%) trades lower after the EIA report showed natural gas...

    TransAtlantic Petroleum (TAT -6.9%) trades lower after the EIA report showed natural gas inventories rose more-than-expected last week. Natural gas inventories for the week ending July 8 came in at 84bcf, higher than analysts estimates of 78bcf.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • BB

    It can't be good for the stock price when analysts ask if a company could "disappear." Needham's...

    It can't be good for the stock price when analysts ask if a company could "disappear." Needham's Charlie Wolf raises the issue with Research In Motion (RIMM -1.9%), that RIM’s inability to respond to the iPhone "has increased the likelihood that it will." While BlackBerry's "lock on the business market" keeps it alive for now, RIM will become "a shadow of its former self" if it can't figure out the consumer market.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM | 3 Comments
  • RTI

    Titanium products maker RTI International (RTI -12%) is plunging following a downgrade from...

    Titanium products maker RTI International (RTI -12%) is plunging following a downgrade from Goldman to Sell. Goldman believes the company may face a "significant margin squeeze" due to an expected increase in titanium sponge prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • OILT

    Oiltanking Partners (NYSE:OILT) makes a strong debut on the NYSE, opening +12% before setting...

    Oiltanking Partners (NYSE:OILT) makes a strong debut on the NYSE, opening +12% before setting back to +9.5%. The firm provides storage and pipeline services for oil concerns, and pays out cash to investors at $1.35/share for a 6.1% yield.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM | 1 Comment
  • UFPI

    Building products manufacturer Universal Forest Products (NASDAQ:UFPI) is up 20.4% after...

    Building products manufacturer Universal Forest Products (NASDAQ:UFPI) is up 20.4% after reporting FQ2 EPS of $0.22, well ahead of the $0.15 consensus. The company also announced it had named VP Matthew J. Missad its new CEO, following ex-CEO Michael B. Glenn's June resignation.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • BTH

    Blyth (BTH +7.1%) jumps after CEO Robert Goergen reports in an SEC filing overnight that he and...

    Blyth (BTH +7.1%) jumps after CEO Robert Goergen reports in an SEC filing overnight that he and affiliates now own 37% of the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • NTGR

    Netgear (NASDAQ:NTGR) shares, which have more than doubled in the last 12 months, are down 3.8%...

    Netgear (NASDAQ:NTGR) shares, which have more than doubled in the last 12 months, are down 3.8% today, as Barclays' Jeff Kvaal cuts his rating to Equal Weight on a valuation basis. Nonetheless, Kvaal believes Netgear can reach its $2B revenue target due to consumer and small business growth, and has been taking share from Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • RMD

    Shares of ResMed (RMD +5.5%) pop on heavy volume a day after UBS says the company will get a...

    Shares of ResMed (RMD +5.5%) pop on heavy volume a day after UBS says the company will get a margin boost in the 4Q ahead of expectations.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • BHC

    Medicis Pharmaceutical (MRX -3.6%) slides after reports that a woman was found dead at CEO Jonah...

    Medicis Pharmaceutical (MRX -3.6%) slides after reports that a woman was found dead at CEO Jonah Shacknai's home, which local police described as occurring under "suspicious circumstances." A Wells Fargo analyst says the company has a contingency plan to cover a worst-case scenario, and recommends buying shares on weakness.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • ON

    More on Fairchild Semiconductor (FCS +5.4%): Q2 earnings rose 2.5%, topping estimates on strong...

    More on Fairchild Semiconductor (FCS +5.4%): Q2 earnings rose 2.5%, topping estimates on strong demand from its industrial, automotive and appliance customers. Revenue jumped 5.8% to $433M, coming in at the high-end of projections.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • DELL-OLD

    Shares of Dell (DELL-OLD +2.4%) gain after the computer maker improved market share, according...

    Shares of Dell (DELL-OLD +2.4%) gain after the computer maker improved market share, according to preliminary data from Gartner. Dell accounted for 12.3% of global PC shipments in 2Q, as it moved to #2 in PC shipments for the first time since 2008.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • IXYS

    IXYS pops +3.88% after saying it expects record June quarter sales exceeding $100M, beating Wall...

    IXYS pops +3.88% after saying it expects record June quarter sales exceeding $100M, beating Wall Street estimates of $99M. Its book-to-bill ratio is estimated to be in the high range of 1.10 to 1.15, with a record backlog of $190M to $195M.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • WSM

    Williams-Sonoma (WSM +2.5%) paces retail stocks after shares are raised to Buy from Neutral by...

    Williams-Sonoma (WSM +2.5%) paces retail stocks after shares are raised to Buy from Neutral by Goldman Sachs. The firm sees multiple expansion as the company exceeds consensus forecasts, supported by solid high-end and home furnishings sector sales trends, including a high concentration of online sales, and the potential for a global presence.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM
  • INO

    Inovio Pharmaceuticals (INO +2.7%) gains at the open after announcing Phase I tests on T cell...

    Inovio Pharmaceuticals (INO +2.7%) gains at the open after announcing Phase I tests on T cell and antibody responses were successful in its clinical study of VGX-3400X, a vaccine to prevent avian H5N1 influenza.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM
  • EA

    Electronic Arts (ERTS -2.1%) plans to issue $550M in convertible senior notes due in 2016. The...

    Electronic Arts (ERTS -2.1%) plans to issue $550M in convertible senior notes due in 2016. The company, which has over $2.2B in cash and investments and no debt, plans to use part of the proceeds to help pay for its acquisition of PopCap Games. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:35 AM
  • NTRI

    Wedbush ups Nutrisystem (NASDAQ:NTRI) to outperform, saying easier comps, new product launches,...

    Wedbush ups Nutrisystem (NASDAQ:NTRI) to outperform, saying easier comps, new product launches, and an improved competitive environment make the shares compelling at current levels. Shares +6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM
  • COP

    ConocoPhillips' (NYSE:COP) spinoff shines a light on rivals Chevron (NYSE:CVX) and Exxon...

    ConocoPhillips' (NYSE:COP) spinoff shines a light on rivals Chevron (NYSE:CVX) and Exxon (NYSE:XOM) to see if they follow a similar course. Investors will push for the move, but the firms may move slow to decide. Premarket: COP +8%, XOM +0.8%, CVX +1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM | 2 Comments
  • COP

    Premarket gainers: COP +9%. IRE +5%. SUG +5%. RENN +4%. LYG +4%. GPL +4%. AG +4%. SVM +3%. JPM...

    Premarket gainers: COP +9%. IRE +5%. SUG +5%. RENN +4%. LYG +4%. GPL +4%. AG +4%. SVM +3%. JPM +3%. YUM +3%.
    Losers: MRX -5%. MAR -5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • MAR

    FBR Capital's Patrick Scholes says 2Q results for Marriott International (NYSE:MAR) were...

    FBR Capital's Patrick Scholes says 2Q results for Marriott International (NYSE:MAR) were "anything but fantastic" after the firm merely matched estimates. As for the future, the analyst says "the outlook isn't great" for the firm. Shares -4.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:53 AM | 1 Comment
  • IMAX

    Friday's debut of Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2 is set to open in a record number...

    Friday's debut of Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2 is set to open in a record number of IMAX theaters, and is posting the the strongest advance ticket sales of any release to date. Separately, Cannacord reinstates coverage with a buy, calling it "an exceptional growth story." Shares +2.83% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:29 AM
  • JAZZ

    Jazz Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:JAZZ) receives coverage from Piper Jaffray with an initial rating...

    Jazz Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:JAZZ) receives coverage from Piper Jaffray with an initial rating of Overweight and a $51 price target. Shares +1.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:28 AM
  • MTH

    Meritage Homes (MTH -1.5%) cut to Neutral from Buy at Goldman, though price target is lowered...

    Meritage Homes (MTH -1.5%) cut to Neutral from Buy at Goldman, though price target is lowered only slightly to $24 from $25. Goldman believes the first-time market for homes is not well-positioned for recovery. (see also: TOL upgrade)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:24 AM | 1 Comment
  • NUAN

    Voice recognition software firm Nuance (NASDAQ:NUAN) is acquiring medical transcription services...

    Voice recognition software firm Nuance (NASDAQ:NUAN) is acquiring medical transcription services provider Webmedx for an undisclosed price. Nuance is also introducing a version of its Dragon software for the iPhone and iPod Touch. Shares +1.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:17 AM
  • WMB

    Williams (WMB -1%) raises its bid for Southern Union (NYSE:SUG), offering $44/share in cash....

    Williams (WMB -1%) raises its bid for Southern Union (NYSE:SUG), offering $44/share in cash. Energy Transfer (ETE) previously bid $40/share, while Williams had originally proposed $39/share. SUG +4.3% to $43.37. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:12 AM
  • COP

    Investors are gushing on ConocoPhillips (COP +8.1%) splitting into two companies: Exploration...

    Investors are gushing on ConocoPhillips (COP +8.1%) splitting into two companies: Exploration & Production and Refining & Marketing. The separation is expected to be completed in H1 2012, at which point CEO Jim Mulva intends to retire. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:44 AM
